oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Hermitage of today
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of The Hermitage with trees overhanging the sidewalk where a couple walks toward the building.

This image shows how The Hermitage was believed to have looked at the time Andrew Jackson resided there, 1834-1835. When Bernardt Wall visited The Hermitage, the building was under the management of the Ladies' Hermitage Association. This image was etched from studies made at the time of his stopover
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Hermitage (Hermitage, Tenn.)
Historic buildings; Dwellings; Houses; Historic sites
